alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Muskogee; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:32AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Craig, eastern Rogers, northwestern Delaware, Mayes, eastern Wagoner, northwestern Cherokee and northeastern Muskogee Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 432 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Adair to 4 miles southwest of Chouteau to 2 miles southeast of Taft. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Wagoner... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Fort Gibson... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Okay... Hulbert... Porter... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Big Cabin... Braggs... Taft... Pensacola... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 261 and 283. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Muskogee; Rogers; Wagoner
